children.text: The ceiling joists in this area are spaced at greater than 600mm centres, which will not properly support the ceiling plasterboard sheets.

The relevant Australian Standards AS 1684 and AS 2589.1, and the plaster manufacturer all require that the ceiling framing members be spaced at maximum 600mm centres to properly support the ceiling plasterboard, to prevent sagging or failure.
Additional joists, battens, or trimmers will need to be installed so that the plasterboard sheets can be securely fixed to the framing at their required centres.
